short_summary: The Health Products and Food Branch (HPFB) aims to better inform Canadians to help them make healthy choices by modernizing business efficiency, improving data analytics capacity, alternating service delivery models and enhancing regulatory transparency and openness.
description: The Health Products and Food Branch (HPFB) aims to better inform Canadians to help them make healthy choices by modernizing business efficiency, improving data analytics capacity, alternating service delivery models and enhancing regulatory transparency and openness. HPFB will make transparency the default way of doing business, while respecting the legitimate interest of businesses as necessary, protecting privacy and meeting other legal obligations. The main objectives have been to ensure HPFB’s data is secure by developing data disaster recovery plans and software performance is maintained and improved. HPFB plans to continue investing in various IT projects to improve and expedite current processes and ensure consistent and seamless storage continuity and capabilities. As such, Health Canada has a need for a Contractor’s services to offer service/system analysing services to review stored digital information holdings to improve transparency across the HPFB.
full_summary:
# Health Products and Food Branch (HPFB) Tender Announcement

## Request for Proposal

The Health Products and Food Branch (HPFB), a department of Health Canada, is soliciting proposals for a Storage Architect / Platform Analyst contractor. The successful contractor will be responsible for providing service/system analyzing services to review stored digital information holdings and improve transparency across the HPFB.

## Tender Overview

* The tender reference is PW-22-01007738, with an amendment number of 2.
* The solicitation number is 1000238952, and the tender publication date was November 30, 2022.
* The tender closing date was December 22, 2022, at 2:00 PM EST.

## Tender Requirements

The HPFB is seeking a contractor to provide services for:
* Analyzing stored digital information holdings to improve transparency
* Developing data disaster recovery plans
* Improving software performance and maintenance
* Enhancing regulatory transparency and openness

## Business Requirements

* Must provide service/system analyzing services
* Must have experience with IT project management and data analytics
* Must have expertise in developing data disaster recovery plans and improving software performance
* Must have knowledge of business process improvement and regulatory requirements

## Procurement Method

* Competitive - Limited tendering
* Trade agreements: Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA), Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, and others

## Important Dates

* Tender closing date: December 22, 2022
* Expected contract start date: Not specified
* Expected contract end date: Not specified

## Contact Information

* Taylor Komery, Program Manager
* Email: [taylor.komery@hc-sc.gc.ca](mailto:taylor.komery@hc-sc.gc.ca)
* Phone: 343-575-3015
